info.title: Identity And Access Management
info.description: The CPN Identity and Access management APIs provide VMware Partners capabilities to create and/or perform role assignment for principals like users, enterprise groups and Oauth apps in Partner organizations ; and to generate access tokens for these principals using standard Oauth flows.

tags.name: Auth Service Authentication API
tags.description: APIs to manage and handle tokens.

tags.name: Auth Service Notifications API
tags.description: Internal Resource to perform bulk operation on services, orgs and users.

tags.name: Auth Service Permission Enforcement API
tags.description: Handles requests from other microservices to authorize access to their own resources.

tags.name: Auth services task monitoring API
tags.description: Resource for monitoring role CRUD tasks.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Resource to manage and handle api-tokens and refresh-tokens to authenticate and make authorized API connections.

tags.name: CPHub Db Encryption API's
tags.description: Internal resource to encrypt the db.

tags.name: Federation
tags.description: Resource to manage and access federation operations.

tags.name: Principal User
tags.description: Resource to get the logged in users details.

tags.name: Service Account APIs
tags.description: Resource to manage INTERNAL/EXTERNAL Service Accounts.

tags.name: Service Organization
tags.description: Resource for all org-based identity operations.

tags.name: User
tags.description: Resource to manage and customize users access in the organization. Users are granted access to the organization and services when roles are assigned  to them.

tags.name: Organization Managed OAuth Apps
tags.description: Resource to perform CRUD operation on Organization Managed OAuth Apps.

tags.name: Organization Managed OAuth Apps Client
tags.description: Resource to perform CRUD operation on Organization Managed Clients.

tags.name: Login Flow APIs
tags.description: Resource to manage differnet login flows. Used by CPN UI.

tags.name: Session APIs
tags.description: Resource to perform session related operations.

post.summary: Takes a refresh token as input and returns a new access token as the output
post.description: Takes a refresh token as input and returns a new access token as the output. In the request body, also pass the passcode if MFA is enabled.

requestBody.description: Request body to fetch access token

get.description: Lists all enterprise groups in a specified Provider organization.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: - Fetch the groups for the given Provider orgId

parameters.name: pageLimit
parameters.description:
- Maximum number of groups to return in
response. Defaults to 100

parameters.name: pageStart
parameters.description: - Start index of records to fetch. Defaults to 1

post.description: Assigns organization and service roles to a specified enterprise group within a Provider organization.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: - Provider organization selected for which the Group roles will be assigned

requestBody.description: - Payload that captures Group role

delete.summary: Removes the roles of a specified enterprise group in an Organization
delete.description: Removes the roles of a specified enterprise group within a Provider organization and removes the group.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: - Provider organization selected for which the Group roles will be assigned

requestBody.description: - Payload that captures Group role

get.description: Searches for federation groups by name within a Provider organization. The search criteria is captured in the searchTerm parameter. Search results are paginated and returned as GroupDto object.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Unique identifier (GUID) of the Provider organization.

parameters.name: pageLimit
parameters.description:
- Maximum number of groups to return in
response. Defaults to 200

parameters.name: pageStart
parameters.description: - Start index of records to fetch. Defaults to 1

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description:
- This parameter is mandatory parameter, the results will be filtered based on the given
string value

get.summary: Get all enterprise groups of the Identity Provider ID of the logged user
get.description: Returns a list of all enterprise groups of the Identity Provider ID of the logged user. This operation only works if the logged user account has the required roles assigned.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: - GroupId is used to fetch users that belong to the given group

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Unique identifier (GUID) of the Provider organization.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: - Fetches users with the email, This is a optional parameter

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: - Fetches users with the firstName, This is a optional parameter

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: - Fetches users with the lastName, This is a optional parameter

parameters.name: pageLimit
parameters.description:
- Maximum number of groups to return in
response. Defaults to 200

parameters.name: pageStart
parameters.description: - Start index of records to fetch. Defaults to 1

get.description: Retrieve org bindings for Group Within and heirarchy of provider organizations

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: - GroupId is used to fetch users that belong to the given group

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Unique identifier (GUID) of the Provider organization.

parameters.name: roleId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the role.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context can be OPERATOR, PROVIDER or TENANT.

get.summary: Get organization and service roles of a specified enterprise group
get.description: Lists the organization and service roles of a specified enterprise group within a Provider organization.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: - GroupId for which the groups will be fetched, this parameter mandatory

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: - Provider orgId for which the roles will be fetched

patch.summary: Update organization and service roles of a specified enterprise group
patch.description: Updates the organization and service roles of a specified enterprise group within a Provider organization.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: - Group selected for which the roles will be updated

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: - Provider organization selected for which the Group roles will be Updated

requestBody.description: - Payload contains the roles to be added and deleted from the group

post.description: Adds new users to a Provider organization and assigns service and organization roles to their accounts. If a user has previously set up VMware ID with their email, they are immediately added to your organization. If a user does not have VMware ID set up, they receive an invitation to create a VMware ID and join your organization.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Unique identifier (GUID) of the Provider organization.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: context can be OPERATOR, PROVIDER or TENANT.

requestBody.description: Request body to add users in an organization

400.description: Bad Request - The request is either incomplete or incorrect

401.description: Unauthorized - The user is not authorized to use the API

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error has occurred while processing the request

AuthenticationTokens.title: AuthenticationTokens

accessToken.description: The access token. This is a JWT token that grants access to resources.

idToken.description: The ID Token is a signed JWT token returned from the authorization server and contains the user's profile information, including the domain of the identity provider. This domain is used to obtain the identity provider URL. This token is used for optimization so the application can know the identity of the user, without having to make any additional network requests. This token can be generated via the Authorization Code flow only.
